4-Week Online Bootcamp

Intro to Data Science

R, Visualization, Classification, Regression, Clustering

Learn to solve real-world problems with quick and powerful analytic tools.

Data never sleeps. The Big Data you keep hearing about is an explosion of all kinds of information created by people, media, businesses, government–the list goes on and on. If you’re not working with the data that affects your business, you’re already behind the curve. There’s a data set waiting for you to extract a hidden insight that makes a crucial difference. That’s where our course comes in.

We’ll show you how to analyze data quickly and easily using the same methods professional data scientists use. And we’ll teach you in language you already understand. The good news is you have the most important ingredient you’ll need: expertise in your field.

You know your business best. That’s why you should be the one working with your data. In just 4 weeks, you’ll build a toolkit using R, a free open source programming language. R is widely used in corporations that do extensive data mining, like Google and Amazon. But R is also easy to learn and there are many existing scripts that make analyzing and visualizing data a breeze.

When you’re done, you’ll be able to ask questions and pose problems like a data scientist. You’ll have the tools to implement, execute, and explain your predictive models and algorithms. And you’ll be able to create beautiful visualizations to share your insights with others.

4-Week Online Boot Camp

Saturdays and Sundays, 9 am – 12 pm

"Data Society provided an insightful, energetic overview of highly complex statistical topics in an accessible and understandable way."Chris M.

Course Details

Just bring your curiosity

No math or programming background is required. We’ll present the material in regular human language and explain concepts in ways that are easy-to-understand but always academically sound.

Week 1

Feb 7 & 8

Intro to R & Visualization
Introduction to data analytics, R, and its uses. Plus: create beautiful visualizations with just a couple of lines of code.

What you’ll learn:

  • Structuring data problems
  • Thinking like a data scientist
  • A primer on programming and visualizations

Week 2

Feb 14 & 15

Classification & Customer Behavior
Classify a piece of information based on similar objects. What can you understand about your customers, based on their shopping habits?

Techniques you’ll learn:

  • k-Nearest Neighbors
  • Naive Bayes
  • Logistic regression
  • Decision trees
  • Random forests

Week 3

Feb 21 & 22

Clustering & Mining Your Social Media
How do people cluster within a network and what can we learn from it? How can we interpret brand perception? What connections can we find from text data between ideas, people and events?

Techniques you’ll learn:

  • K-means
  • Hierarchical clustering

Week 4

Feb 28 & Mar 1

Regression & Conclusion
How do politics affect our economy?  Learn to identify global and local trends using different regression methods. Plus, putting it all together: a framework for working with data and its results, limits and next steps.

Techniques you’ll learn: 

  • Simple linear regression
  • Functional regression
  • Multivariate regression
  • Locally weighted scatterplot smoothing (LOWESS)

Syllabus is subject to change.

Start date:
February 7, 2015

Register Now

 

The course takes place on an innovative online learning platform where you’ll use a mix of interactive elements:

  • Weekly live video webcasts led by our outstanding instructors
  • Archived webcasts for review
  • Breakout sessions for coding exercises and discussion
  • Group leaders to answer your questions and provide feedback
  • Real world data sets from Best Buy, Twitter, the stock market, and lots more
  • A thriving online community of smart professionals and data enthusiasts sharing questions, insights, and support

At the end of the course, you’ll know:

  • The foundations of data science classification methods
  • The necessary tools to implement, execute, and explain your predictive models and algorithms
  • Basics of the R programming language
  • A great new community of fellow data enthusiasts and a way to stay in touch with them

And you’ll also get:

  • A copy of all slides, exercises, data sets, and R scripts
  • A certificate of completion for your employer or yourself

Why Take this Course?

Gain a competitive edge

Companies that don’t analyze data on their business and their customers simply can’t compete. You may be able to look at analytics of some sort, but remember—analytics are not analysis. Humans do analysis. You’ll need to step back to look at the big picture and then dig deeper for insights that will give you a competitive advantage.

Data Society courses are different.

We jump right in to get you coding on the spot. We use real world data sets from places like Best Buy, Twitter, and the stock market to teach you basic theories and tools (if you’ve taken other courses, you’ve watched them dust off the same old data sets over and over.) We’re all online, with live webcasts that are also archived, so you can catch up later if you miss a session. Our online platform has many ways to connect with your course mentors and peers both in session and throughout the course and we think that’s really one of the best features of the program.

Here’s why people like you take this course:

  • You want to make smarter decisions. Your business is generating data and it’s all just piling up waiting for you to ask meaningful questions and extract valuable answers.
  • You want to advance and expand your career.  Learn how to quickly gain insights from large data sets and present the results to your colleagues in beautiful visualizations. Your boss will thank you.
  • You want to switch job tracks.  A recent study by the McKinsey Global Institute estimates that by 2018 there will be 4-5 million jobs in the U.S. requiring data analysis skills – and large numbers of positions will only be filled through training or retraining. We’ll get you started.
  • You like to do cool things with data. Got a side project you want to get off the ground? Learn the skills you need to take it to the next level.
